Implemented policies and procedures to administer executive compensation programs.  Designed multiple costing, accounting and tax models to assist clients with selection of program alternatives. Implemented systems to automate multiple job functions.  Consistently exceeded target fee realization ratios on all client relationships. personality:
From reading between the lines of this resume, I can discern several personality traits and characteristics:

1. Detail-Oriented & Meticulous
- The extensive listing of skills and accomplishments shows someone who doesn't overlook details
- Their work history shows consistent attention to complex financial and regulatory matters
- High GPAs throughout their academic career suggest careful attention to their work

2. Achievement-Driven
- Graduated in top 10% of class
- Consistent career progression
- Multiple mentions of exceeding targets and implementing improvements

3. Organized & Systematic
- Career progression shows logical steps
- Experience in creating and maintaining various systems and procedures
- Strong focus on process improvement and automation

4. Conservative & Risk-Aware
- Background in compliance and regulatory work
- Experience in financial oversight and monitoring
- Career choices show preference for established institutions

5. Professional & Formal
- Language choice is very corporate and structured
- Career path shows traditional progression
- Focus on established business processes and systems

6. Self-Motivated & Independent
- Long tenure as a consultant (18 years)
- History of implementing new systems and procedures
- Pattern of taking initiative in various roles

This person appears to be a thorough, systematic professional who values stability and structure, but also has the confidence and capability to work independently. They likely prefer organized, well-defined environments where they can apply their analytical skills and attention to detail.

Would you like me to elaborate on any of these observations?
